::Fenox::

Fenox's eyes softened slightly at the mournful whine that had 
originated from D at the news of the deaths of his shipmates. She 
reached out and put a hand on his shoulder.

"I'm sorry about your friends. Ship wrecks happen sometimes though."

She nodded at his question, understanding this one. "Sure, I'll show 
you around. You can even meet our commander. Here, follow me."

She turned and walked to the entrance to the Iron Fist, walking over 
the short bridge that crossed the water that separated the 
battlecruiser from the land and entering. She turns around, motioning 
for D to follow.



--- In nbwrpg@y..., "Megan Solmonson" <tmrattrap@h...> wrote:
> 
> 
> * Yes!! She had finally gotten what he was trying to say!
> Though, his happyness was short lived when he heard the words to 
follow the 
> first.
> D almost couldn't believe it! They were dead, all dead?!
> His ears pressed against his head and he whined, long and mournful. 
He bowed 
> his head and sat there.
> Even the woman who was so nice to him...dead.
> He knew what death was and he didn't like it.
> D heaved a sigh and looked out towards the edge of the island, 
wondering 
> just where that ship was where the deaths of friends lingered.
> But he knew better then to linger over death too much, wondering if 
he would 
> make any friends here that might replace the ones he lost.
> One never knew.
> D looked at Fenox, slightly whining again. But he soon got to his 
feet and 
> shook himself, still slightly saddened but thinking that dwelling on 
it 
> wouldn't help. They were gone and there was nothing he could do 
about it.
> He gestured towards the Iron Fist.*
> 
> " Show?"
> 
> * He wanted to see the inside, maybe meet some more of these beings 
of 
> steel.*
> 
> 
> 
>
